p: Four doses of this extract were administered to animals: 25, 50, 100, and 200 mg/kg BW. These doses have been extrapolated from previous studies realized on rats [ 25, 29]. Uhunmwangho and Omoregie [ 25] reported that the oral administration of 50 mg/kg of the methanol extract of D. edulis fruit induced antioxidant activity in rats. This dose was therefore divided by 2 to obtain the lowest dose of 25 mg/kg. The doses of 100 and 200 mg/kg were obtained by multiplying 50 mg/kg by 2 and 4, respectively.
